required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Using Breath Metabolites to Determine Specific Virus Infection in Asthmatic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Using Breath Metabolites to Determine Specific Virus Infection in Asthmatic Patients

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: Respiratory virus infections cause a majority of asthma exacerbations in the fall to spring months. Current diagnostic platforms for respiratory viruses have limitations including cost, availability, and invasiveness. The use of noninvasive breath collection to analyze breath metabolites may be used to differentiate virus-infected asthmatics from other causes of acute asthma exacerbations.

primary_outcome.description: Metabolites from breath will be identified and quantified using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry; these will be compared between groups. Specific breath metabolites include isoprostane, linear and branched alkanes (C6-C9), alcohols, and thiol-containing moieties. However, we will also measure metabolites in an un-targeted manner.

clinical_study.condition: Upper Respiratory Tract Infections, Asthma, Exhaled Breath

arm_group.description: Asthmatic patients not with an exacerbation, i.e., stable asthmatics
Asthmatics with an exacerbation and associated rhinovirus infection
Asthmatics with an exacerbation and associated influenza A infection

intervention.description: Breath from humans is cooled, condensed, and collected

study_pop.textblock: Patients with asthma with or without an acute exacerbation will be recruited

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Asthma, Age ≥12, Symptoms/signs of an early asthma exacerbation, Ability to provide exhaled breath condensate (EBC) x15 min, Body mass index (BMI) ≥18
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic lung diseases other than asthma (e.g., chronic obstructive pulmonary disease [COPD], lung cancer, fibrotic lung disease, etc.), Smoking in the past 7 days, Eating or non-clear liquids <4 hrs prior to EBC collection, Pregnancy

facility.name: University of California Davis Medical Ceneter
